intro: Thismia alba, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its lack of leaves and its unique, elongated white flowers. The plant relies on mycorrhizal fungi for its nutrition, as it lacks chlorophyll and cannot perform photosynthesis. Its flowers are often pollinated by specific insects, making it highly specialized in its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss and its elusive nature, Thismia alba is considered endangered and is rarely seen in the wild.
